# Advanced KQL for Microsoft Sentinel
---

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.description: Select a Workspace to be used for 'Try it in your environment'

content.json:
Workbook version: 1.0
Kusto Query Language (KQL) is the language used in Microsoft Sentinel to perform search, analysis, write detection rules and visualise data in Workbooks. This interactive Workbook is designed to help you improve KQL proficiency by taking a use-case driven approach based on: - Grouping KQL operators/commands by Category for easy navigation. - Listing possible tasks an user would perform with KQL in Microsoft Sentinel. Each task includes KQL operators used, sample queries and use cases.
- Compiling a list of existing content found in Microsoft Sentinel (Analytics Rules, Hunting Queries, Workbooks and etc) to provide additional references specific to the KQL operators you want to learn. - Allowing you to execute the sample queries on the fly with your own environment or "LA Demo" - a public demo environment. Try the sample KQL statements in real time without the need to navigate away from the Workbook.
(**Note**: if using your own workspace, you need to ensure you have the relevant data already ingested)

How to use this Workbook

1. Begin by select a **Category** that suits the outcomes you would like to achieve with KQL. Alternatively, you can refer to "**Table of Contents**" for an overview of what is covered under each Category. 2. After clicking on a Category, you will be presented a list of tasks under "**I want to**". Select a task that suits your requirement. 3. Review the Operators, sample queries, sample use cases and reference resources found in Microsoft Sentinel accordingly. 4. Try the queries in your own environment or "LA Demo" using the "**Try it**" buttons.

**Note:**
- "**Try it in your environment**" button will only be visible when the **Workspace parameter** at the top of the Workbook is populated.
- **LA Demo** environment might not have all the tables or data specified for each sample queries and use cases.

## Category

# {Category}

Overview:

Datetime is one of the most common data types that users need to deal with in Microsoft Sentinel. For example, filtering your records based on specific dates, days or hours. Datetime value in Microsoft Sentinel is always in the UTC time zone. Displaying datetime values in other time zones is the responsibility of the user application that displays the data, not a property of the data itself. Should time zone values be required to be kept as a part of the data, a separate columns should be used (providing offset information relative to UTC). Besides that, every table in the workspace has the following built-in columns which will be populated by default when data are being ingested into the table. - [TimeGenerated](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/log-standard-columns#timegenerated-and-timestamp) - [_TimeReceived](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/log-standard-columns#_timereceived) - [ingestionTime](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/kusto/query/ingestiontimefunction)
I want to:

links.linkLabel: 1. Filter a specific datetime or time range
3. Add or deduct a datetime value

content.json:
## 1. Filter a specific datetime or time range ### a) By date, day or time

     Operators to be used:

      **- [ago()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/agofunction)**       **- [between()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/betweenoperator)**       **- [now()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/nowfunction)**       **- [dayofweek()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/dayofweekfunction)**       **- [hourofday()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/hourofdayfunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns SecurityEvent records for the past 7 days**

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(7d)

**      - Returns SecurityEvent records for the past 30 minutes **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(30m)

**      - Returns SecurityEvent records from '2021-07-16' to '2021-07-24'**

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated between (datetime('2021-07-16')..datetime('2021-07-24'))

**      - Returns SecurityEvent records from '2021-07-21 16:20:00' to now**

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated between (datetime('2021-07-21 16:20:00')..now())

**      - Returns SecurityEvent records for Monday to Saturday, 7am to 7pm (UTC) **

         SecurityEvent
         | where dayofweek(TimeGenerated) !=0d // To retrieve data for all days except Sunday.
         | where (hourofday(TimeGenerated)>7 and hourofday(TimeGenerated)<19) // To filter 7am ‚Äì 7pm


     Sample use cases:

**      - Failed logons on computers by month **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4625
         | extend month = getmonth(TimeGenerated)
         | summarize FailedLogonCount=count() by month

**      - Calculates the ingestion delay and returns the top percentiles by computer **

         SecurityEvent
         | extend delay = ingestion_time() - TimeGenerated
         | summarize percentiles(delay,95,99) by Computer

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

####       Analytics Rules:       **- [User account enabled and disabled within 10 mins](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/UserAccountEnabledDisabled_10m.yaml)**       **- [User account created and deleted within 10 mins](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/UserAccountCreatedDeleted_10m.yaml)**       **- [User login from different countries within 3 hours (Uses Authentication Normalization)](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/84deef53a17d0f989b9098d92e051fad09d9e568/Detections/ASimAuthentication/imAuthSigninsMultipleCountries.yaml)**       **- [Failed logon attempts by valid accounts within 10 mins](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/gte_6_FailedLogons_10m.yaml)**       **- [TI map URL entity to Syslog data](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/ThreatIntelligenceIndicator/URLEntity_Syslog.yaml)** ####       Hunting Queries:       **- [User account created and then deleted within 10 minutes across last 14 days](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting%20Queries/SecurityEvent/UserAccountCreatedDeleted.yaml)**       **- [SharePointFileOperation via devices with previously unseen user agents](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Hunting%20Queries/OfficeActivity/new_sharepoint_downloads_by_UserAgent.yaml)**       **- [Inactive or New Account Usage](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Hunting%20Queries/GitHub/Inactive%20or%20New%20Account%20Usage.yaml)**       **- [Suspicious Windows Login outside normal hours](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Hunting%20Queries/SecurityEvent/Suspicious_Windows_Login_outside_normal_hours.yaml)**       **- [Login spike with increase failure rate](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Hunting%20Queries/SigninLogs/LoginSpikeWithIncreaseFailureRate.yaml)** ####       Workbook:       **- [ExchangeOnline](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Workbooks/ExchangeOnline.json)**

## 2. Compare datetime ### a) Between two dates

     Operators to be used:

      **- [datetime_diff()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datetime-difffunction)**       **- [iif()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/iiffunction)**       **- [next()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/nextfunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Calculates the difference in minute between TimeGenerated and now**

         SecurityEvent
         | extend DeltaInMinute = datetime_diff('minute', now(),TimeGenerated)
         | project TimeGenerated, DeltaInMinute, EventID, EventData

**      - Calculates the difference in second between TimeGenerated of every recond ingested by a computer **

         SecurityEvent
         | where Computer == "RETAILVM01"
         | order by TimeGenerated asc
         | extend nextTimeGenerated = next(TimeGenerated, 1)
         | extend TimeDeltainSeconds = datetime_diff('second',nextTimeGenerated,TimeGenerated)

**      - Calculates the difference in Hour between Incident creation time and closure time.**

         SecurityIncident
         | where Status == "Closed"
         | extend DeltaInHour = datetime_diff('hour', ClosedTime,CreatedTime)
         | extend DeltaInHour = datetime_diff('hour', ClosedTime,CreatedTime)
         | project CreatedTime, ClosedTime, DeltaInHour, IncidentNumber, Title, Severity


     Sample use cases:

**      - Finds CEF records by computer where last received time is more than 30 minutes ago **

         CommonSecurityLog
         | summarize last_log = datetime_diff('minute',now(), max(TimeGenerated)) by Computer
         | where last_log > 30
         | project-rename ['Last Record Received in Minute'] = last_log
         | order by ['Last Record Received in Minute'] desc

**      - Compares the ingestion volume of security events between now and 3 days ago **

         let binSize = 15m;
         let refDelay = 3d;
         let EndTime = now();
         let StartTime = EndTime - 1d;
         let ReferenceEndTime = EndTime - refDelay;
         let ReferenceStartTime = StartTime - refDelay;
         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated between (StartTime .. EndTime) or TimeGenerated between (ReferenceStartTime .. ReferenceEndTime)
         | extend RefTimeGenerated = iif(TimeGenerated between (StartTime .. EndTime),TimeGenerated, TimeGenerated + refDelay)

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

####       Analytics Rules:       **- [AD user enabled and password not set within 48 hours](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/password_not_set.yaml)**       **- [Palo Alto - potential beaconing detected](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Detections/CommonSecurityLog/PaloAlto-NetworkBeaconing.yaml)**       **- [Fortinet - Beacon pattern detected](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Detections/CommonSecurityLog/Fortinet-NetworkBeaconPattern.yaml)** ####       Hunting Queries:       **- [Entropy for Processes for a given Host](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/5a81ffa8c10b001be41d6fda3ade45384a1a2eb8/Hunting Queries/SecurityEvent/ProcessEntropy.yaml)**       **- [Interactive STS refresh token modifications](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting Queries/AuditLogs/StsRefreshTokenModification.yaml)**

## 3. Add or deduct a datetime value

     Operators to be used:

      **- [datetime_add()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datetime-addfunction)**       **- [Numerical Operator (+,-)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/numoperators)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Add 2 hours to TimeGenerated (for time offset)**

         SecurityEvent
         | extend TimeOfEventOffset = datetime_add('hour',2, TimeGenerated)
         | project TimeOfEventOffset, EventID, EventData

**      - Minus 8 hours from TimeGenerated (for time offset)**

         SecurityEvent
         | extend TimeOfEventOffset = datetime_add('hour',-8, TimeGenerated)
         | project TimeOfEventOffset, EventID, EventData

**      - Perform subtraction between two dates using the numerical operator**

         SecurityEvent
         | extend delta = now() - TimeGenerated
         | project TimeGenerated, delta, EventID, EventData


     Sample use cases:

**      - Calculates the ingestion delay and returns the top percentiles by computer **

         SecurityEvent
         | extend delay = ingestion_time() - TimeGenerated
         | summarize percentiles(delay,95,99) by Computer

## 4. Convert datetime ### a) To another format

     Operators to be used:

      **- [format_datetime()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/format-datetimefunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Formats TimeGenerated to 'yy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss' **

         SecurityEvent
         | project TimeGenerated = format_datetime(TimeGenerated, 'yy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss'), EventID, EventData

**      - Formats TimeGenerated to 'yyyy/MM/dd' **

         SecurityEvent
         | project TimeGenerated = format_datetime(TimeGenerated, 'yyyy/MM/dd'), EventID, EventData

**      - Shows AM /PM hours**

         SecurityEvent
         | extend AmPm = format_datetime(TimeGenerated,"tt")
         | project TimeGenerated = TimeGenerated, AmPm, EventID, EventData


     Sample use cases:

**      - Calculates the daily Incident count for the last 7 days**

         SecurityIncident
         | where CreatedTime > ago(7d)
         | extend Day = format_datetime(TimeGenerated,"yyyy-MM-dd")
         | distinct IncidentNumber, Day
         | summarize Count=count() by Day

     Sample queries:

**      - Get the month number from TimeGenerated and summarize the event count. **

**      - Get the total security event by day of week.**

         dayofweek(TimeGenerated)==time(2.00:00:00), "Tuesday",
         dayofweek(TimeGenerated)==time(3.00:00:00), "Wednesday",
         dayofweek(TimeGenerated)==time(4.00:00:00), "Thursday",
         dayofweek(TimeGenerated)==time(5.00:00:00), "Friday",
         "Saturday")
         | order by TimeGenerated desc

**      - Returns windows logon events on Satuday and Sunday**

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624
         | where dayofweek(TimeGenerated) in (time(0.00:00:00),time(6.00:00:00))

In most cases, you need to limit your search results based on specific criteria by applying filters. Use [where](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/whereoperator) operator to contruct the filter statement and [project](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/projectoperator) operator to select the columns to be included in the result.

content.json:
## 1. Perform a simple filter on string ### a) Case-sensitive full string values

     Operators to be used:

      **- [==](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!=](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [in](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!in](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**

     Sample queries:

        **Note:** Try swapping the string values to lower/upper case to compare the results.

**      - Returns Storage Accounts List keys action with success status value**

         AzureActivity
         | where OperationNameValue == "MICROSOFT.STORAGE/STORAGEACCOUNTS/LISTKEYS/ACTION"
         | where ActivityStatusValue == "Success"

**      - Returns Key Vault access policies update with status value NOT equal to "Failure" **

         AzureActivity
         | where OperationNameValue == "MICROSOFT.KEYVAULT/VAULTS/ACCESSPOLICIES/WRITE"
         | where ActivityStatusValue != "Failure"

**      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel incidents with High and Medium severity**

         SecurityIncident
         | where Severity in ("High", "Medium")

**      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel closed incidents with classification not equal to FalsePositive and Undetermined **

         SecurityIncident
         | where Status == "Closed"
         | where Classification !in ("FalsePositive", "Undetermined")

### b) Case-insensitive full string values

        **Note:** Avoid using case-insensitive operators when possible for a better query performance.

     Operators to be used:

      **- [=~](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!~](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [in~](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!in~](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns Storage Accounts List keys action with success status value **

         AzureActivity
         | where OperationNameValue =~ "MICROSOFT.STORAGE/STORAGEACCOUNTS/LISTKEYS/action"
         | where ActivityStatusValue =~ "success"

**      - Returns Key Vault access policies update with status value NOT equal to "Failure" **

         AzureActivity
         | where OperationNameValue =~ "MICROSOFT.KEYVAULT/VAULTS/ACCESSPOLICIES/write"
         | where ActivityStatusValue !~ "failure"

**      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel incidents with High and Medium severity **

         SecurityIncident
         | where Severity in~ ("high", "medium")

**      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel closed incidents with classification not equal to FalsePositive and Undetermined **

         SecurityIncident
         | where Status =~ "closed"
         | where Classification !in~ ("falsepositive", "undetermined")

### c) Case-sensitive partial string values

     Operators to be used:

      **- [has_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!has_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [contains_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!contains_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [hasprefix_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!hasprefix_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [hassuffix_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!hassuffix_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [startswith_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!startswith_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [endswith_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!endswith_cs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns Powershell command executions on Virtual Machine **

         | where EventID == 4688
         | where CommandLine has_cs "powershell.exe"

         SecurityEvent

         | where CommandLine contains_cs "powershell.exe"

**      - Summarizes Security Events count by Account and Activity but excluding Workgroup account **

         SecurityEvent

         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !hasprefix_cs "WORKGROUP"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !startswith_cs "WORKGROUP"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

**      - Returns account logon successfully events for Computer with prefix "DC0" **

         | where Computer hasprefix_cs "DC0"

         | where EventID == 4624
         | where Computer startswith_cs "DC0"

**      - Returns special privileges assigned to new logon events for Computer with suffix "contosohotels.com" **

**      - Returns special privileges assigned to new logon events for Computer NOT end with "contosohotels.com" **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer !endswith_cs "contosohotels.com"

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer !hassuffix_cs "contosohotels.com"

### d) Case-insensitive partial string values

        **Note:** Avoid using case-insensitive operators when possible for a better query performance.

     Operators to be used:

      **- [has](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!has](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [has_all](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/has-all-operator)**       **- [has_any](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/has-anyoperator)**       **- [contains](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!contains](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [hasprefix](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!hasprefix](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [hassuffix](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!hassuffix](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [startswith](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!startswith](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [endswith](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**       **- [!endswith](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns Powershell command executions on Virtual Machine **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4688
         | where CommandLine has "POWERSHELL.EXE"

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4688
         | where CommandLine contains "POWERSHELL.EXE"

**      - Summarizes Security Events count by Account and Activity but excluding Workgroup account **

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !has "Workgroup"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !contains "Workgroup"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !hasprefix "Workgroup"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

         SecurityEvent
         | where Account !startswith "Workgroup"
         | summarize count() by Account, Activity

**      - Returns total logon successful events for Computer with prefix "DC00" or "DC01" **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624
         | where Computer hasprefix "dc00" or Computer hasprefix "dc01"
         | summarize count() by Computer

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624
         | where Computer startswith "dc00" or Computer startswith "dc01"

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624

**      - Returns total security events for Computer with hostname "DC01" and domain name "contosohotels" **

         SecurityEvent
         | where Computer has_all ("dc01","ContosoHotels")
         | summarize count() by Computer

**      - Returns special privileges assigned to new logon events for Computer with suffix "contosohotels.com" **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer hassuffix "ContosoHotels.Com"

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer endswith "ContosoHotels.Com"

**      - Returns special privileges assigned to new logon events for Computer NOT end with "contosohotels.com" **

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer !endswith "ContosoHotels.Com"

         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer !hassuffix "ContosoHotels.Com"

**      - SignIn logs with results NOT equal to [result type](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatypes-string-operators) "success" (0), "interupted because of password reset" (50125) and "keep me signed in" (50140) **

         | where Entities matches regex '"HostName": "DESKTOP"*'

potential beaconing detected](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Detections/CommonSecurityLog/PaloAlto-NetworkBeaconing.yaml)** ####       Hunting Queries::       **- [Rare Process Path](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/SecurityEvent/RareProcessPath.yaml)**       **- [Rare processes run by Service accounts](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/SecurityEvent/RareProcbyServiceAccount.yaml)**       **- [FireEye stolen red teaming tools communications](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting Queries/MultipleDataSources/FireEyeRedTeamComms.yaml)**       **- [Exploit and Pentest Framework User Agent](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting Queries/MultipleDataSources/UseragentExploitPentest.yaml)**       **- [Exchange Server ProxyLogon URIs](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting Queries/W3CIISLog/ExchangeServerProxyLogonURI.yaml)**       **- [RareDNSLookupWithDataTransfer](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Hunting Queries/MultipleDataSources/RareDNSLookupWithDataTransfer.yaml)**

## 5. Filters events that occurred consecutively or in a specific sequence/pattern

     Operators to be used:

      **- [make_list](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/makelist-aggfunction)**       **- [mv-apply](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/mv-applyoperator)**       **- [prev](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/prevfunction)**       **- [minif()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/minif-aggfunction)**       **- [maxif()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/maxif-aggfunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns windows logon events where logon failure occurred before logon success within the 30 minutes window**

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID in (4624,4625)
         | summarize FirstLogonTime = minif(TimeGenerated,EventID==4624), FirstFailureTime =
         minif(TimeGenerated,EventID==4625) by bin(TimeGenerated,30m), Computer, Account
         | where FirstLogonTime > FirstFailureTime

**      - Returns accounts with more than five AAD signin failures and at least a signin success event within the 30 minutes window**

         SigninLogs
         | extend FailureOrSuccess = iff(ResultType in ("0", "50125", "50140", "70043", "70044"), "Success", "Failure")
         | sort by UserPrincipalName, TimeGenerated
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), IPAddress =
         make_set(IPAddress), make_list(FailureOrSuccess), FailureCount =
         countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Failure"), SuccessCount = countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Success")
         by bin(TimeGenerated, 30m), UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName
         | where FailureCount >5 and SuccessCount >0

**      - Returns accounts who have two AAD signin failures in a row, followed by a successful logon**

         SigninLogs
         | extend FailureOrSuccess = iff(ResultType in ("0", "50125", "50140", "70043", "70044"), "Success", "Failure")
         | sort by UserPrincipalName, TimeGenerated
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), IPAddress =
         make_set(IPAddress), make_list(FailureOrSuccess), FailureCount =
         countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Failure"), SuccessCount = countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Success")
         by bin(TimeGenerated, 30m), UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName
         | where list_FailureOrSuccess matches regex '"Failure","Failure","Success"'


     Sample use cases:

**      - Identifies Sign-in Failure after ProofPoint ClicksPermitted event**

         let SignInFailure = (
         SigninLogs
         | where ConditionalAccessStatus == "failure"
         | extend DataType = "SignInFailure"
         | project EventTime=CreatedDateTime, recipient_s=trim(" ",UserPrincipalName), DataType
         );
         let ProofPointClicksPermitted =(
         ProofPointTAPClicksPermitted_CL
         | where classification_s == "malware"
         | extend DataType = "ClicksPermitted"
         | project EventTime=clickTime_t, recipient_s=trim(" ",recipient_s), classification_s,url_s, DataType
         );
         union isfuzzy=true SignInFailure,ProofPointClicksPermitted
         | sort by EventTime, recipient_s
         | summarize StartClickTime=minif(EventTime,DataType=="ClicksPermitted"),EndClickTime=maxif(EventTime,DataType=="ClicksPermitted"),
         StartLoginFailureTime=minif(EventTime,DataType=="SignInFailure"),EndLoginFailureTime=maxif(EventTime,DataType=="SignInFailure"),
         make_list(DataType), make_list(url_s) by recipient_s
         | where StartLoginFailureTime > StartClickTime or StartLoginFailureTime > EndClickTime or
         EndLoginFailureTime > StartClickTime or EndLoginFailureTime > EndClickTime

**      - Identifies brute force attack against Azure Portal with the pattern of 5 consecutive failures followed by 1 successful logon within 30 minutes**

         let failureCountThreshold = 5;
         let successCountThreshold = 1;
         let authenticationWindow = 30m;
         SigninLogs
         | extend DeviceDetail = todynamic(DeviceDetail), Status = todynamic(DeviceDetail), LocationDetails = todynamic(LocationDetails)
         | extend OS = DeviceDetail.operatingSystem, Browser = DeviceDetail.browser
         | extend StatusCode = tostring(Status.errorCode), StatusDetails = tostring(Status.additionalDetails)
         | extend State = tostring(LocationDetails.state), City = tostring(LocationDetails.city), Region =
         tostring(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion)
         | where AppDisplayName has "Azure Portal"
         | where ResultType !in (70043,70044)
         );
         | extend FailureOrSuccess = iff(ResultType in ("0", "50125", "50140", "70043", "70044"), "Success", "Failure")
         | sort by UserPrincipalName, TimeGenerated
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), IPAddress =
         make_set(IPAddress), make_set(OS), make_set(Browser), make_set(City),
         make_set(State), make_set(Region),make_set(ResultType),make_list(FailureOrSuccess), FailureCount =
         countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Failure"), SuccessCount = countif(FailureOrSuccess=="Success")
         by bin(TimeGenerated, authenticationWindow), UserDisplayName, UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName, Type
         | where FailureCount >= failureCountThreshold and SuccessCount >= successCountThreshold
         | where list_FailureOrSuccess matches regex '"Failure","Failure","Failure","Failure","Failure","Success"'

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

####       Analytics Rules:       **- [Multiple authentication failures followed by a success](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/MultipleFailedFollowedBySuccess.yaml)**       **- [Brute force attack against Azure Portal](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/SigninLogs/SigninBruteForce-AzurePortal.yaml)**       **- [Anomalous login followed by Teams action](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/AnomalousIPUsageFollowedByTeamsAction.yaml)**       **- [User account created and deleted within 10 mins](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/SecurityEvent/UserAccountCreatedDeleted_10m.yaml)**       **- [User account enabled and disabled within 10 mins](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/SecurityEvent/UserAccountEnabledDisabled_10m.yaml)**

# {Category}

Overview:

Functions are reusable queries which provide a way for analyst to simplify complex KQL queries and increase the efficiency of analysis. One of the common methods to improve modularity and reuse in KQL is using [let](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/letstatement) statements to bind names to your expressions. The name can then be used to refer to its bound value as [user-defined functions and views](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions). You can also [save query as function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#create-a-function) and run the query regulary by calling the function name without the need of re-writing the whole query. Parameters can be added to functions as input arguments so that you can provide values for certain variables when calling it. This allows the same function to be used in different queries, each providing different values for the parameters. In Microsoft Sentinel, the [Microsoft Sentinel Information Model (ASIM)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/normalization-about-parsers) parsers leverage functions to parse and normalize data at query time.
I want to:

links.linkLabel: 1. Bind name to expression using ‚Äòlet‚Äô operator
2. Create or save a query as function for reuse purposes

content.json:
## 1. Bind name to expression using 'let' operator ### a) Define simple contants or scalar values

     Operators to be used:

      **- [let](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/letstatement)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Use let operator to bind a constant**

         let timeframe = 1d;
         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe)

**      - Use let operator to bind a dynamic list **          Returns Activity logs with keyvault deletion or Azure resource deployment operations.

         let operationList = dynamic(["MICROSOFT.KEYVAULT/VAULTS/DELETE",
         "MICROSOFT.RESOURCES/DEPLOYMENTS/WRITE"]);
         AzureActivity
         | where OperationNameValue in (operationList)
         | where ActivityStatusValue == "Success"

**      - Use let operator to bind scalar value**          Returns Security Events for a list of pre-defined servers

         let Computerlist =(
         Heartbeat
         | where Computer startswith "DC"
         | distinct Computer
         );
         SecurityEvent
         | where Computer in (Computerlist)

**      - Use let operator to bind expression **          Returns Windows logon failure events for a list of pre-defined servers

         let DC_list =(
         Heartbeat
         | where Computer startswith "DC"
         | distinct Computer
         );
         let LogonFailureEvent =(
         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4625
         | summarize count() by Account, Computer, EventSourceName, Activity
         );
         LogonFailureEvent
         | where Computer in (DC_list)

Sample use cases:

**      - Identifies account with the number of Azure AD logon failure exceeded the defined threshold **

         let Threshold = 5;
         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType != "0"
         | summarize Count=count() by UserPrincipalName
         | where Count > Threshold

**      - Returns Azure AD logon failure events within a specified time range **

         let timeframe = 1d;
         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType != "0"
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe)

**      - Returns AAD logon events NOT matches a list of [result types](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/reference-aadsts-error-codes#aadsts-error-codes) **

         let ResultTypeList = dynamic(["0","50125","50140"]);
         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType !in (ResultTypeList)

**      - Returns "Special privileges assigned to new logon" Security Events for a list of pre-defined servers **

         let DC_list = (
         Heartbeat
         | where Computer startswith "DC"
         | distinct Computer
         );
         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4672
         | where Computer in (DC_list)
         | summarize count() by Account, Computer, EventSourceName, Activity

**      - Returns SharePointFileOperation via devices with user agents unseen in last 90 days **

         let HistoricalLookback = 90d;
         let RecentLookback = 1d;
         let lookback = now() - RecentLookback - HistoricalLookback;
         let historicalActivity= materialize( OfficeActivity
         | where RecordType == "SharePointFileOperation"
         | where Operation in ("FileDownloaded", "FileUploaded")
         | where TimeGenerated between(lookback .. (now()-RecentLookback))
         | summarize historicalCount=count() by UserAgent, RecordType);
         let recentActivity = materialize(OfficeActivity
         | where RecordType == "SharePointFileOperation"
         | where Operation in ("FileDownloaded", "FileUploaded")
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(RecentLookback)
         | summarize
         StartTime = min(TimeGenerated),
         EndTime = max(TimeGenerated),
         recentCount=count()
         by UserAgent, RecordType);
         recentActivity
         | join kind = leftanti (
         historicalActivity
         )
         on UserAgent, RecordType
         | order by recentCount asc, UserAgent


        **Note: You can use [materialize()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/materializefunction) to cache a subquery result during query execution.**

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

IPs](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/OfficeActivity/SharePoint_Downloads_byNewIP.yaml)**       **- [GitHub Activites from a New Country](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/GitHub/GitHub Activities from Infrequent Country.yaml)**       **- [Failed logon attempts in authpriv](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/Syslog/FailedLogonAttempts_UnknownUser.yaml)**       **- [Possible contact with a domain generated by a DGA](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Detections/CommonSecurityLog/MultiVendor-PossibleDGAContacts.yaml)**       **- [Failed host logons but success logon to AzureAD](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/HostAADCorrelation.yaml)**       **- [Suspicious Resource deployment](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/2cad1a602c99d6e3f8be2548e31e4ca63ed75c6f/Detections/AzureActivity/NewResourceGroupsDeployedTo.yaml)**       **- [AD user enabled and password not set within 48 hours](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/45da87dec250017c0fd45cb55842e6d6cde8f1ee/Detections/SecurityEvent/password_not_set.yaml)** ####       Hunting Queries:       **- [Rare Custom Script Extension](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Hunting%20Queries/AzureActivity/Rare_Custom_Script_Extension.yaml)**       **- [Rare DNS Lookup With Data Transfer](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Hunting Queries/MultipleDataSources/RareDNSLookupWithDataTransfer.yaml)**       **- [Potential DGA detected](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Hunting Queries/DnsEvents/DNS_HighPercentNXDomainCount.yaml)**       **- [Potential Microsoft security services tampering](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting Queries/MultipleDataSources/PotentialMicrosoftSecurityServicesTampering.yaml)**       **- [GitHub Inactive or New Account Access or Usage](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/GitHub/Inactive or New Account Usage.yaml)**       **- [Unused or Unsupported Cloud Regions](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/AWSCloudTrail/AWS_Unused_UnsupportedCloudRegions.yaml)**       **- [Hosts with new logons](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/SecurityEvent/HostsWithNewLogons.yaml)**       **- [Hosts running a rare process](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting Queries/SecurityEvent/RareProcess_forWinHost.yaml)**

## 2. Create or save a query as function for reuse purposes ### a) Create a function without Parameters **      - Returns both AAD Signin failure and Windows logon failure with a single command "LogonFailure"**          [Create a function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#create-a-function) (without parameter) called "LogonFailure" with the below query.

         let AADSigninFailure=(
         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType !in ("0", "50125", "50140", "70043", "70044")
         | project TimeGenerated, UserPrincipalName, SourceIP=IPAddress, Target=AppDisplayName
         );
         let WindowsLogonFailure=(
         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4625
         | project TimeGenerated, UserPrincipalName =
         strcat(TargetUserName,"@",TargetDomainName,".com"), SourceIP = IpAddress, Target = Computer
         );
         union isfuzzy=true AADSigninFailure, WindowsLogonFailure


        
         Then, execute the function by running **LogonFailure** in Logs page.         
### b) Create a function with Parameters       We can parameterize functions for better reuseability (a single function can be used repeatably with different inputs). **      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel Incidents with specified status (single parameter)**          [Create a function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#create-a-function) (with parameter = status) called "GetIncident" with the below highlighted query body.

         let GetIncident =(status:string){
         SecurityIncident
         | where Status =~ status
         };
         GetIncident("new")


        
         Then, execute the function by running **GetIncident("new")** or **GetIncident("closed")**         
**      - Returns Microsoft Sentinel Incidents with specified status and severity (two parameters)**          Similar to the above sample, this sample gives you the flexibility to query Incidents with different status and severity by using the sample function but different parameter values.          [Create a function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#create-a-function) (with two parameter ‚Äì status and severity) called "GetIncident2" with the below highlighted query body.

         let GetIncident2 =(status:string, severity:string){
         SecurityIncident
         | where Status =~ status
         | where Severity =~ severity
         };
         GetIncident2("new", "high")


        
         Then, execute the function by running **GetIncident2("new","high")** or **GetIncident2("closed","high")**

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

####       Analytics Rules:       **- [Failed login attempts to Azure Portal](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/SigninLogs/FailedLogonToAzurePortal.yaml)**       **- [Brute force attack against Azure Portal](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/SigninLogs/SigninBruteForce-AzurePortal.yaml)**       **- [Failed AzureAD logons but success logon to host](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/AADHostLoginCorrelation.yaml)**       **- [Failed AzureAD logons but success logon to AWS Console](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/AADAWSConsoleCorrelation.yaml)**       **- [IP with multiple failed Azure AD logins successfully logs in to Palo Alto VPN](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/AAD_PAVPN_Correlation.yaml)** ####       Additional Resources:       **- [Azure-Sentinel/Parsers at master ¬∑ Azure/Azure-Sentinel (github.com)](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Parsers)**       **- [Azure-Sentinel/Exploration Queries at master ¬∑ Azure/Azure-Sentinel (github.com)](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Exploration Queries)**       **- [Enriching Windows Security Events with Parameterized Function - Microsoft Tech Community](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/azure-sentinel/enriching-windows-security-events-with-parameterized-function/ba-p/1712564)**       **- [https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/Functions](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/Functions)**

## 3. Build an ASIM Normalizing parser      [ASIM Normalizing parsers](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/normalization-about-parsers) are [KQL user-defined functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions) that parse and transform data at query time into the normalized schema.
     The parser query includes the following parts: **       Filter > Parse > Prepare fields**

    Sample use case:

     Let's say we have the following custom table called MyCustomEvent that stored process events.
     We will walk through step by step on how to create an ASIM ProcessEvent parser.
     Since the above sample data are fictitious and will not be available in any environment. We will use [let](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/letstatement) and [datatable](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/datatableoperator?pivots=azuredataexplorer) operators to create the      sample data during run time.      Below is the query for the sample data. [Create a function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#create-a-function) (without parameter) called MyCustomEvent with the query.      **Note: Kindly update the date values in TimeGenerated field to your current date so that you don't need to change the Time Range      in Logs page.**

         let MyCustomEvent = datatable ( TimeGenerated:datetime, Activity:string, ProcessName:string,
         SubjectAccount:string,TargetAccount:string, Computer:string, ProcessID:int, Command:string)
         [
         '8/25/2021, 10:54:26.537 AM', 'A new process has been created successfully', @'C:\Program
         Files\PostgreSQL\13\bin\postgres.exe','John.Doe','John.Doe','VM01', 12345678, @'"C:/Program
         Files/PostgreSQL/13/bin/postgres.exe" "--forkavworker" "5256"'
         , '8/25/2021, 10:55:26.253 AM', 'Timeout waiting for the service to connect',
         @'C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe','John.Doe','John.Doe',
         'VM01', 53536456, @'powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Restricted -Command Write-Host "Final result: 1"'
         , '8/25/2021, 11:10:12.126 AM', 'A process has been terminated successfully', @'C:\Program
         Files\PostgreSQL\13\bin\postgres.exe','John.Doe','', 'VM02', 12345678, @'"C:/Program
         Files/PostgreSQL/13/bin/postgres.exe" -V'
         , '8/25/2021, 11:15:36.334 AM', 'A new process has been created successfully',
         @'C:\Windows\System32\cscript.exe','administrator','administrator', 'VM02', 79035635,
         @'"C:\windows\system32\cscript.exe" /nologo "ChangeEventModuleBatchSize.vbs"'
         ];
         MyCustomEvent


    Review the Schema:

     Let‚Äôs review the Process event normalization schema [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/process-events-normalization-schema#schema-details). Based on the schema, we have the following information:         ‚Ä¢ **The mandatory fields are as below:**
               ‚Ä¢ EventCount
               ‚Ä¢ EventStartTime
               ‚Ä¢ EventEndTime
               ‚Ä¢ EventType
               ‚Ä¢ EventResult
               ‚Ä¢ EventProduct
               ‚Ä¢ EventVendor
               ‚Ä¢ EventSchemaVersion
               ‚Ä¢ Dvc
               ‚Ä¢ ActorUsername
               ‚Ä¢ ActorUsernameType
               ‚Ä¢ ActingProcessId
               ‚Ä¢ ParentProcessId
               ‚Ä¢ TargetUsername - (Mandatory for process create events)
               ‚Ä¢ TargetUsernameType - (Mandatory for process create events)
               ‚Ä¢ TargetProcessName
               ‚Ä¢ TargetProcessCommandLine
               ‚Ä¢ TargetProcessCreationTime
               ‚Ä¢ TargetProcessId
        ‚Ä¢ **EventType field supports the following values:**
               ‚Ä¢ ProcessCreated
               ‚Ä¢ ProcessTerminated         ‚Ä¢ **EventResult field supports the following values:**
               ‚Ä¢ Success
               ‚Ä¢ Partial
               ‚Ä¢ Failure
               ‚Ä¢ NA

    Create the parser:

####     Filter:      First, we need to filter the relevant events. We are only interested on "A new process has been created successfully" and "A process has      been terminated successfully" events.

         MyCustomEvent
         | where Activity in ("A new process has been created successfully","A process has been terminated successfully")


####     Parse:      In this example, we don't need to perform any phasing or extraction on any column.
     However, we need to assign the EventType field based on Activity using [iif](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/iiffunction) statement.

         MyCustomEvent
         | where Activity in ("A new process has been created successfully","A process has been terminated successfully")
         | extend EventType = iif(Activity =="A new process has been created successfully","ProcessCreated","ProcessTerminated")


####     Prepare fields:      In the final step, we need to prepare the fields in the result set to ensure that the normalized fields are used according to the [schema](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/process-events-normalization-schema#schema-details).      We will use [extend](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/extendoperator) to create fields that didn‚Äôt exist in the orignal data (such as EventCount, EventResult, EventProduct and etc), or map new      fields to existing data (such as EventStartTime, EventEndTime, TargetProcessCreationTime and ActingProcessId).      Besides that, [project-rename](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/projectrenameoperator) will be used for fields that exist in the original data but with a different name compared to the schema.      Below is the final query with all the mandatory fields and an optional field (EventMessage):

         MyCustomEvent
         | where Activity in ("A new process has been created successfully","A process has been terminated successfully")
         | extend EventType = iif(Activity =="A new process has been created successfully","ProcessCreated","ProcessTerminated")
         | extend EventCount = 1
         | extend EventStartTime = TimeGenerated
         | extend EventEndTime = TimeGenerated
         | extend TargetProcessCreationTime = TimeGenerated
         | extend EventResult = "Success"
         | extend EventProduct = "MyCustomEvent"
         | extend EventVendor = "MyDemo"
         | extend EventSchemaVersion = "0.1.0"
         | extend ActorUsernameType = "Windows"
         | extend TargetUsernameType = "Windows"
         | extend ParentProcessId = int(null)
         | extend ActingProcessId = ProcessID
         | project-rename Dvc=Computer, ActorUsername=SubjectAccount, TargetUsername=TargetAccount, TargetProcessName=ProcessName,
         TargetProcessCommandLine=Command, TargetProcessId= ProcessID, EventMessage=Activity


     **Note:** We should have all the mandatory fields. Any original fields that are not normalized should not be removed from the result using      project-away.      Lastly, let‚Äôs create a function for our parser called MyCustomProcessParser with the query above.

Add your parser to the schema source-agnostic parser:

     Firstly, deploy [ASIM ProcessEvent parsers](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Parsers/ASimProcessEvent) if they didn't exist in your environment.      Next, we can add MyCustomProcessParser to the source-agnostic parser (imProcess) to take advantage of built-in Microsoft Sentinel content      that support ASIM normalization. To do that, [edit imProcess function](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/functions#edit-a-function) to include MyCustomProcessParser in the union statement.          union isfuzzy=true
         vimProcessEmpty,
         vimProcessEventMicrosoft365D,
         vimProcessCreateMicrosoftSysmon,
         vimProcessTerminateMicrosoftSysmon,
         vimProcessCreateMicrosoftSecurityEvents,
         vimProcessTerminateMicrosoftSecurityEvents,
         vimProcessCreateLinuxSysmon,
         vimProcessTerminateMicrosoftWindowsEvents,
         vimProcessCreateMicrosoftWindowsEvents,
         vimProcessEventAD4IoT,
         MyCustomProcessParser

# {Category}

Overview:

Dynamic array values are widely found in logs of Microsoft Sentinel. For example, entities and custom details of SecurityAlert table, AlertIds and labels of SecurityIncident table, and many more.
The array values are represented within [] and you would need to expand the array values into rows or columns for correlation.
I want to:

links.linkLabel: 1. Expands dynamic array values into rows or columns
2. Packs multiple fields into a dynamic array

content.json:
## 1. Expands dynamic array values into rows or columns. ### a) Expand multi-value dynamic arrays into multiple rows.

     Operators to be used:

      **- [mv-expand](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/mvexpandoperator)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Expands Host entities from SecurityAlert into multiple rows**

         SecurityAlert
         | extend d = parse_json(Entities)
         | mv-expand d
         | where isnotempty(d.HostName)
         | project HostName = tostring(d.HostName), AlertName, Description , TimeGenerated

**      - Expands Account entities from SecurityAlert into multiple rows **

         SecurityAlert
         | extend d = parse_json(Entities)
         | mv-expand d
         | where isnotempty(d.Name) and d.Type == "account"
         | project Account = tostring(d.Name), AlertName, Description, TimeGenerated

**      - Expands Incident tags into multiple rows**

         SecurityIncident
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentNumber
         | extend d = parse_json(Labels)
         | mv-expand d
         | project TimeGenerated,IncidentNumber,Title,CreatedTime, Description, Severity, Tag= d.labelName

**      - Expands Incident Alert Ids into multiple rows**

         SecurityIncident
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentNumber
         | mv-expand AlertIds
         | project TimeGenerated, IncidentNumber, Title, CreatedTime, AlertIds


     Sample use cases:

**      - Expands AlertIds of Incident to correlate with SecurityAlert **

         SecurityIncident
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentNumber
         | mv-expand AlertIds
         | project TimeGenerated, IncidentNumber, IncidentTitle=Title, IncidentCreatedTime=CreatedTime, tostring(AlertIds)
         | join kind =leftouter (SecurityAlert
         | project tostring(SystemAlertId), ProviderName, AlertStartTime=StartTime,
         AlertEndTime=EndTime, Entities, ExtendedProperties)
         on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
         | project-away SystemAlertId, AlertIds

### b) Expand multi-value dynamic arrays into multiple columns.

     Operators to be used:

      **- [bag_unpack](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/bag-unpackplugin)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Expands custom details of SecurityAlert into multiple columns**

         SecurityAlert
         | extend customDetails = parse_json(tostring(parse_json(ExtendedProperties).["Custom Details"]))
         | where isnotempty(customDetails)
         | project TimeGenerated, AlertName, AlertSeverity, StartTime, EndTime, customDetails
         | evaluate bag\_unpack (customDetails, "custom\_")

**      - Expands device details of SignIn logs into multiple columns **

         SigninLogs
         | project TimeGenerated, UserPrincipalName, IPAddress, ResultDescription, AppDisplayName, DeviceDetail, Location
         | evaluate bag_unpack (DeviceDetail)


     Sample use cases:

**      - Expands modifiedProperties field of audit events when a user is added to any Azure Active Directory Privileged Groups **

         AuditLogs
         | where OperationName in ("Add member to role","Add member to role in PIM completed (permanent)")
         | mv-expand TargetResources
         | project TimeGenerated, OperationName, TargetResources, InitiatedBy
         | extend TargetResources = parse_json(TargetResources)
         | extend modProps = TargetResources.modifiedProperties
         | extend TargetUser = TargetResources.userPrincipalName
         | extend InitiatedBy = iif(isnotempty(parse_json(parse_json(InitiatedBy).user).displayName),
         parse_json(parse_json(InitiatedBy).user).displayName,parse_json(parse_json(InitiatedBy).app).displayName)
         | mv-expand bagexpansion=array modProps
         | evaluate bag_unpack(modProps)
         | project-away TargetResources

## 2. Packs multiple fields into a dynamic array

     Operators to be used:

      **- [pack_array](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/packarrayfunction) (Packs all values into a dynamic array)**       **- [pack](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/packfunction) (Create a dynamic object from a list of names and values)**       **- [make_list](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/makelist-aggfunction) (Returns a dynamic (JSON) array of all the values)**       **- [make_set](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/makeset-aggfunction) (Returns a dynamic (JSON) array of the set of distinct values)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Packs Incident Title, Severity and Status fields as Incident Details**

         SecurityIncident
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by IncidentNumber
         | project TimeGenerated, IncidentNumber, Title, Severity, Status
         | extend IncidentDetails = pack_array(Title, Severity, Status)
         | project TimeGenerated, IncidentNumber, IncidentDetails

**      - Summary of Account logon with a column packed with Computer**

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624
         | summarize Details = make_list(Computer) by Account, bin(TimeGenerated,1h)

**      - Summary of Account logon with a column packed with Computer and Datetime**

         SecurityEvent
         | where EventID == 4624
         | summarize Details = make_list(pack('Computer', Computer, 'DateTime', TimeGenerated)) by Account, bin(TimeGenerated,1h)

**      - Summary of Event IDs (packed in a column) by Computer**

         SecurityEvent
         | summarize Events = make_set(EventID) by Computer


     Sample use cases:

**      - Packs IPAddress, Location and ClientAppUsed fields into an array for AAD SignIn failure**

         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType !in ("0", "50125", "50140", "70043", "70044")
         | project TimeGenerated, Location, AppDisplayName, ClientAppUsed, IPAddress, UserPrincipalName
         | extend UserDetails = pack_array(IPAddress, Location,ClientAppUsed)
         | project TimeGenerated, UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName, UserDetails

**      - Summary of AAD SignIn with status and IP Address packed into columns **

         SigninLogs
         | extend OS = DeviceDetail.operatingSystem, Browser = DeviceDetail.browser
         | extend State = tostring(LocationDetails.state), City = tostring(LocationDetails.city), Region = tostring(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion)
         | extend StatusCode = tostring(Status.errorCode), StatusDetails = tostring(Status.additionalDetails)
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), Status =
         make_list(Status), IPAddresses = make_list(IPAddress), IPAddressCount = dcount(IPAddress)
         by UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName, tostring(Browser), tostring(OS), City, State, Region, Type

**      - Summary of AAD SignIn with distinct IP Address, OS, Browser, Location, ResultType and AppDisplayName by Account**

         SigninLogs
         | extend OS = DeviceDetail.operatingSystem, Browser = DeviceDetail.browser
         | extend State = tostring(LocationDetails.state), City = tostring(LocationDetails.city), Region = tostring(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion)
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), IPAddress =
         make_set(IPAddress), make_set(OS), make_set(Browser), make_set(City), make_set(State),
         make_set(Region),make_set(ResultType), make_set(AppDisplayName)
         by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d), UserDisplayName, UserPrincipalName

**      - Summary of AAD SignIn with distinct IP Address and Location packed into a column**

         SigninLogs
         | extend OS = DeviceDetail.operatingSystem, Browser = DeviceDetail.browser
         | extend State = tostring(LocationDetails.state), City = tostring(LocationDetails.city), Region = tostring(LocationDetails.countryOrRegion)
         | extend StatusCode = tostring(Status.errorCode), StatusDetails = tostring(Status.additionalDetails)
         | summarize Details = make_set(pack('State', State, 'City', City, 'IPAddress',IPAddress)),StartTime =
         min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated),IPAddressCount = dcount(IPAddress) by UserPrincipalName

# {Category}

Overview:

Aggregations in Microsoft Sentinel are a means of taking large and diverse data sets, reducing them to logically grouped units that make analysis much easier and faster. It involves taking values of multiple rows, performing some form of calculation on them and then returning a summarized value. Aggregations in Microsoft Sentinel are also the basis upon which we build visualization charts as well as workbooks. The summarize operator in KQL is foundational to achieving aggregations.
I want to:

links.linkLabel: 2. Summarize by minimum or maximum column values

content.json:
## 1. Summarize activity frequency across time

     Operators to be used:

      **- [summarize](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/summarizeoperator)**       **- [count()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/count-aggfunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns summary of Account activity over the past 24 hours**

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
         | summarize count() by Account

**      - Returns summary of the count of failed logon attempts by Azure resources **

         SigninLogs
         | where ResultType !=0
         | summarize FailedLoginCount=count() by ResourceDisplayName
         | sort by FailedLoginCount desc nulls last


     Sample use cases:

**      - Detect password spray attack **

         let timeframe = 1d;
         let threshold = 3;
         SigninLogs
         | where TimeGenerated >= ago(timeframe)
         | where ResultType == "50057"
         | where ResultDescription =~ "User account is disabled. The account has been disabled by an administrator."
         | summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), count(), applicationSet =
         make_set(AppDisplayName),ApplicationCount = dcount(AppDisplayName) by UserPrincipalName, IPAddress
         | where ApplicationCount >= threshold

**      - Identify which users were added to a security-enabled group over the last day **

         SecurityEvent
         | extend delay = ingestion_time() - TimeGenerated
         | where EventID in (4728, 4732, 4756) // these event IDs indicate a member was added to a security-enabled group
         | summarize count() by SubjectAccount, Computer, _ResourceId

Check out the relevant samples found in Microsoft Sentinel:

####       Analytics Rules:       **- [Malformed user agent](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/MalformedUserAgents.yaml)**       **- [Potential DGA detected](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/76578d41f67181e6c1acb16b520f48a31d248036/Detections/DnsEvents/DNS_HighNXDomainCount_detection.yaml)**       **- [User login from different countries within 3 hours (Uses Authentication Normalization)](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/84deef53a17d0f989b9098d92e051fad09d9e568/Detections/ASimAuthentication/imAuthSigninsMultipleCountries.yaml)**       **- [Failed AzureAD logons but success logon to AWS Console](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/06832a873e1686244f0bc02b10f79ba879078864/Detections/MultipleDataSources/AADAWSConsoleCorrelation.yaml)** ####       Hunting Queries:       **- [Tracking Privileged Account Rare Activity](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/c69fda6e8b90aa3ae797560b670a42fa8fce2859/Hunting%20Queries/MultipleDataSources/TrackingPrivAccounts.yaml)**       **- [User Login IP Address Teleportation](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting%20Queries/SigninLogs/UserLoginIPAddressTeleportation.yaml)**       **- [Tracking password changes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/158019e9f69d847f506d2f1ba05af0bad64b66dd/Hunting%20Queries/MultipleDataSources/TrackingPasswordChanges.yaml)** ####       Data connectors:       **- [Alcide KAudit](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/DataConnectors/alcide_kaudit.json)**       **- [Better Mobile Threat Defence](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/83c6d8c7f65a5f209f39f3e06eb2f7374fd8439c/DataConnectors/BETTERMTD.json)**

## 2. Summarize by maximum or minimum column values

     Operators to be used:

      **- [arg_max()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/arg-max-aggfunction)**       **- [arg_min()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/arg-min-aggfunction)**       **- [toreal()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/todoublefunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns most current event rows by IP Address within the specified lookback period**

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IpAddress

**      - Returns subset of columns for the most recent records within specified lookback period **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, Computer) by IpAddress

**      - Returns oldest columns within specified lookback period **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
         | summarize arg_min(TimeGenerated, *) by IpAddress


     Sample use cases:

**      - Identify accounts for which most recent activity was logon **

         SecurityEvent
         | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Account
         | where EventID == "4624"
         

**      - Detect infrequently used accounts over the past 90 days **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated < ago(90d)
         | where EventID == 4624
         | where AccountType == "User"
         | summarize Count=count(), LastLogon=arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Account
         | where toreal(Count) <5

## 3. Perform counts by various criteria

     Operators to be used:

      **- [summarize](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/summarizeoperator)**       **- [dcount()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/dcount-aggfunction)**       **- [countif()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/countif-aggfunction)**       **- [sumif()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/sumif-aggfunction)**       **- [percentiles()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/percentiles-aggfunction)**       **- [make_list()](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/makelist-aggfunction)**

     Sample queries:

**      - Returns a distinct count of computers successfully logged on to based on Account type **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
         | where EventID == 4624
         | summarize dcount(Computer) by AccountType

**      - Performs a conditional count based on rows that meet the specified criteria **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1d)
         | summarize RowCount=countif(toint(Level) == 8 ) by Computer
         | sort by RowCount desc

**      - Performs a summation on rows that meet the specified criteria **

         VMConnection
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1d)
         | summarize sumif(BytesSent, SourceIp contains "10.1.1.5")

**      - Creates a list of unique computers **

         VMComputer
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
         | distinct Computer //to eliminate duplicates
         | summarize CompList = make_list(Computer)

     Sample use cases:

**      - Obtain a summary of failed vs successful logons by time and location **

         SecurityEvent
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(7d)
         | summarize Successful=countif(EventID==4624), Failed=countif(EventID==4625) by IpAddress

**      - Groups computers by percentile based on "oldest missing updates" **

         UpdateSummary
         | where TimeGenerated > ago(14d)
         |project Computer, OldestMissingSecurityUpdateInDays
         | summarize percentiles(OldestMissingSecurityUpdateInDays,10,40,80)
